Name: Cylindrical jar
Description: Wheel-made cylindrical pottery receptacle, with elongated body, and slightly constricted mouth. These were used at Abydos in the Ptolemaic Period for the burials of large numbers of mummified ibis, the bird sacred to Thoth, god of writing. From about 700 BC great catacombs were filled with animal and bird mummies; Petrie excavated the ibis tombs at Abydos, within the Early Dynastic brick enclosure some two thousand years older.
